thread.section_title: Top Stories - Football - Sports - The Times of India
thread.title: New-look second division league to have five debutants
thread.title_full: New-look second division league to have five debutants - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: New-look second division league to have five debutants
text:
JAIPUR: The 2nd Division League - scheduled to start from mid-November - is all set to take centrestage in an all-new avatar.
In a bid to spread the game to all corners of the country, the All India Football Federation (AIFF) has for the first time introduced a home-away format for the second-tier competition introducing a MLS-esque western and eastern conference with a total of 11 teams.
There will be five teams making their debut.
The teams, Fateh Hyderabad, Minerva FC (Chandigarh), Gangtok Himalayan SC, Guwahati FC and Neroca FC (Manipur) have all passed the licensing test and will have to fight it out against the perennial heavyweights like Dempo, Mohammedan Sporting, and Lonestar Kashmir.
The eleven teams will be divided into two conferences according to their geographical location; three teams from each conference would qualify for the final stage which would decide the eventual winner.
The total budget, according to sources, is Rs 2.3 crores. A workshop on the same is scheduled to take place next Wednesday.
"I am happy that five new teams have come up. The matches will be played across 10 venues which is again in line with AIFF's mission to make the league pan-India. The best part is the home and away format which gives opportunity to build fanbase," I-League CEO Sunando Dhar told TOI on Thursday.
